node.title: 'Like the floodgates opened': NT's COVID-19 testing system under pressure
node.alt: A car stopped at a drive-through testing clinic at the Katherine District Hospital.
node.description: Testing centres in Katherine and Greater Darwin are being overwhelmed, with the system strugglingÂ to process the volume of tests from Top End exposure sites.
node.content:
["Testing centres in Katherine and Greater Darwin are being overwhelmed, with the system struggling\u00a0to process the volume of tests from Top End exposure sites.", "Long lines of cars queued again on Thursday morning at testing centres in Katherine, where the bulk of new cases in a coronavirus cluster have been confirmed.", "Before the categories of people required to isolate while awaiting tests\u00a0were reduced late yesterday, the main centre in Palmerston, on the edge of Darwin, was struggling\u00a0to process hundreds of tests.", "Palmerston Super Clinic chief executive Robyn Cahill, said her testing team,\u00a0made up of her\u00a0and one other staff member,\u00a0was\u00a0not warned prior to the testing requirements announced by the NT government.\u00a0", "\"It was like the floodgates opened, so we had no\u00a0time to prepare,\" she told ABC Radio Darwin on Thursday morning.\u00a0", "Ms Cahill said her clinic would today refer\u00a0people to a mass-testing centre being established in Mararra, Darwin, this morning.", "\"It has been a really challenging couple of days,\" she said.\u00a0", "The rapid increase in demand for COVID-19 tests from Katherine and Robinson River was also putting pressure on laboratory staff tasked with processing the results, Ms Cahill said.\u00a0", "As a result, it could take people up to 48 hours to receive their results instead of the usual 24 to 36 hours.\u00a0", "The backlog of tests awaiting processing is also affecting health clinics in communities around Katherine.\u00a0", "\"We do have immediate testing capacity in the bush, but it is limited,\" Sinon\u00a0Cooney,\u00a0CEO of Katherine West Regional Health, told ABC Radio Darwin.", "On a typical\u00a0day, the health service normally produces results in an hour.\u00a0", "But Mr Cooney said the demand for dozens of tests was pushing out the turnaround time.\u00a0", "That is why health authorities are asking that only\u00a0close contacts and casual contacts in Katherine, as well as anyone who is showing symptoms, come forward to\u00a0get tested.\u00a0", "\"It's so we don't overwhelm all our resources\u00a0at once,\" Mr Cooney said.\u00a0", "Only after those people have been tested will authorities ask asymptomatic people in the area to come forward, he said.", "
Apologies from NT authorities
", "NT Chief Minister Michael Gunner yesterday apologised to people who had been turned away from Katherine's drive-through testing clinic on Tuesday night.", "\"I am sorry that happened,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We have now made sure that it is clear that the testing clinic will stay open past 6:30pm\u00a0if there are people there to be tested.\"", "But Katherine resident Ben Coutts told\u00a0ABC Radio Darwin\u00a0he struggled to get a test late yesterday.", "He said that after\u00a0calling the COVID hotline and waiting in line for about an hour and 20 minutes, he and his partner\u00a0finally arrived at the front of the queue to find \"a small A3 placard that said 'appointment only'\".\u00a0", "\"We proceeded to let a handful of people know just from the car window down the line,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"Out of 60 cars or 70 cars, half of them\u00a0turned back around.\"", "The man said he and his partner went down to a walk-in clinic, but the line was full of a \"couple of hundred people, all standing about 20cm away from each other and leaning on the fences\".\u00a0", "", "
WA's COVID-19 reopening roadmap
"]
